name: Path N Cervix
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of a pelvic lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 6 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0. (1)

**Note 2:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in M (distant metastasis).

**Note 3:** FIGO Stage IIIB is assigned based on primary tumor extension and/or regional lymph node involvement. If it is unknown whether it is based on extension or regional lymph node involvement, assign to N (regional lymph nodes).  

**Note 4:**  If either exploratory or definitive surgery is done with no mention of lymph nodes, assume nodes are negative.

**Note 5:**  If the clinician says "adnexa palpated" but does not mention lymph nodes, assume lymph nodes are not involved.

**Regional lymph nodes:**

    Iliac, NOS:
       Common
       External
       Internal (hypogastric)
           Obturator
    Paracervical
    Parametrial
    Pelvic, NOS
    Sacral, NOS:
       Lateral (laterosacral)
       Middle (promontorial) (Gerota's node)
       Presacral
       Uterosacral

    Regional lymph nodes, NOS
    Lymph nodes, NOS
footnotes: (1) International Union Against Cancer (UICC) *TNM Classification of Malignant Tumors,* 7th ed., Sobin, LH, Gospodarowicz, M, Wittekind, CH, eds. New York: Wiley, 2009, pg., 210
rows: Regional lymph node(s)  cannot be assessed

Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not stated
Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not documented in patient record

FIGO Stage IIIB based on lymph node involvement

FIGO Stage IIIB with no other information on extension or regional lymph nodes

Stated as N1
Clinically no nodes positive and no pathologic evaluation of nodes
In situ case as defined by TNM and there is a resection of the primary but the nodes are not evaluated pathologically
Pathologic N is not defined for the specific site/histology

No pathologic evaluation of regional lymph nodes and case is not in situ
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed pathologically
No resection of a known primary (not T0)
No surgical resection of primary tumor and no positive biopsy of the highest N 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
